channel.title: Highlight
channel.description:
How would I get my custom quests in the quest menus to highlight? Like in this picture...
[IMG]http://i553.photobucket.com/albums/jj374/AD_Setsuna/questproblem1.jpg[/img]

item.title: Highlight
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Kk, thanks. =[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 19, 2009, 06:40:00 pm[/size][hr]Maybe it has to do with something server sided? Is there any other way to change the colors of the quests other then @yel@? [br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 23, 2009, 03:20:19 pm[/size][hr]Guessing nothingg has been found on it, lol.

Read full topic

@Setsuna wrote:

Doesn’t appear to be working for my yellow or green ones…

Read full topic

item.title: Highlight
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

I’m working on finding a solution right now.

Edit: I got it. It’s this part right here in method105 in the Client class:

if(i4 == 49152)
    i4 = 0xffffff;

You can change it to include other colors by adding them to that if statement (for a list of @XXX@ colors’ hex codes look at Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4.method391()) or include all by deleting that if statement (not the body).
For example, if you wanted to include yellow and green text to be highlighted, you would do this:

if(i4 == 49152 || i4 == 0xffff00 || i4 == 65280)
    i4 = 0xffffff;

Read full topic

item.title: Highlight
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Well, I mean…How would I make it possible for them to change colors during the quest (red for not started, yellow for mid-quest, green for completed) and have it still highlight…? Or do you not know…?

Read full topic

item.title: Highlight
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

You can change it to @yel@ or @gre@ but it won’t be highlighted anymore.
If you write it on the quest list without specifying a color, it’s red by default.

Read full topic

item.title: Highlight
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

When I change both the text in the corner and the text on the actual menu it still highlights it.
Some of the code I posted in that other topic you made had a few mistakes I had to correct, so unless you were able to spot and correct my mistakes maybe that has something to do with it.

Here’s that post:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:4, topic:273447”]Under

class9.aString221 = class30_sub2_sub2.method415();

in Class9.java add

if(class9.aString221.equals("Black Knight's Fortress"))
    class9.aString221 = "Tutorial";

If you have some sort of cache editing tool you can probably use that instead.

If you’re planning on doing it for more than one String, try this:

/**
 * Add the text you want to replace in the first array, and the text to replace it with in the second.
 */
private static String[][] replace = {
{ "Black Knights' Fortress", "Wanted!" }, { "Tutorial", "Example" }
};
for(int i2 = 0; i2 < replace[0].length; i2++)
{
    class9.aString221 = class9.aString221.replaceAll(replace[0][i2], replace[1][i2]);
}

I know, it’s hardcoding. But it’s the best solution I can think of.[/quote]

Edit:
I think I’ve got it.
I noticed yellow text in the quest list on the server I tested this on, and when I hovered over it it didn’t turn white.
Make sure the text being written on the interface is “Tutorial” and not “@red@Tutorial”.

Read full topic

item.title: Highlight
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Well, server side or client side. Would be a great thing to know.

And qwerty…I moved a few of the jagex quests up and down the quest list and they still highlighted…Dunno if that’s still mouse position, since when I put my quests in the same spots they do not highlight or what…Although I think it has something to do with the quest names.

Read full topic

item.title: Highlight
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

The server doesn’t know the position of your mouse. It’s only possible clientside.

Read full topic
